expression: bite off more than you can chew

selectionMeta.selectedPhrase: bite off more than you can chew

step1.sentence: She volunteered to manage three projects at once and soon realized she had bitten off more than she could chew.

step2.story: Ryan said yes to every request in his first month at the new job, eager to impress everyone. By mid-November he had bitten off more than he could chew, and he was staying at the office past midnight just to keep up.

step3.story: The restaurant owner had always dreamed of hosting large private events. When a corporation offered to book the entire venue for a hundred and fifty people on New Year's Eve, he said yes without hesitation. Three weeks before the event, he realized he had bitten off far more than he could chew — his kitchen was too small, his team too lean, and his supplier could not meet the quantities. He spent December scrambling, calling in favors, and sleeping four hours a night. The event went beautifully, but he swore afterward to always calculate capacity before saying yes.

meaning.realUsageKo: 능력이나 여건에 비해 너무 많은 일을 맡았을 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 음식을 한 번에 너무 많이 입에 넣어 씹지 못하는 상황에서 나온 표현입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 욕심이나 자신감 과잉의 결과로 생기는 과부하를 나타내며, 자기 반성적 표현으로도 자주 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He bit off more than he could chew with that timeline.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 그 일정으로 무리한 약속을 한 거예요.
